abstract: Michigan Gov Rick Snyder declares financial emergency in Wayne County, which includes Detroit; county has suffered from unbalanced budgets for four years and has estimated $1.3 billion in unfunded health care liability.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Snyder on Wednesday declared that Wayne County, home to Detroit, is in a financial emergency, agreeing with the findings of a state-appointed review team.

headline.main: Michigan: Wayne County Designated for Financial Emergency Status
headline.print_headline: Michigan: Wayne County Designated for Financial Emergency Status

snippet: Gov. Rick Snyder on Wednesday declared that Wayne County, home to Detroit, is in a financial emergency, agreeing with the findings of a state-appointed review team.
